page.title: 13Recreation-Parks.(1)
page.content: There are three public parks in Tumble, two in Lower Tumble and one in Upper Tumble. The largest of the three is Parc y Mynydd Mawr (Great Mountain) which is in the centre of the village. It was started by the Welfare Association of the village during the 20's after the bulding of the Public Hall. Its chief purpose being to provide for the leisure and recreation of the local miners. In the park there is a children's corner with swings, a see-saw, slide and a climbing frame shaped like an aeroplane and also seats and benches for people to sit on. It has one pavilion, two separate changing rooms, two Rugby pitches, one Soccer pitch, a bowling green and two tennis courts. It is looked after by a full time park keeper/groundsman.
